column4: A new era begins... Good luck to #ArlingtonTX’s newest pro sports franchise, the @XFLRenegades!!!

We’re you thinking football season was over? Think again. Our own @XFLRenegades will host @XFLBattleHawks at the newest football stadium in town!Globe Life Park today at 4 pm, rain or shine. #Arlingtontx – at Globe Life Park in Arlington

UPDATE: Great news everyone!! Our friends at #ArlingtonTX Animal Services just let us know that our #FureverFriday pup Chloe was adopted today!! Here's a picture of her with her new family!! #AmericanDreamCity

Happy #FureverFriday y'all!! This week, Investigator Heather Gibson from our Personnel & Recruiting unit, got to pose with Chloe, a BEAUTIFUL 3-year-old Siberian Husky mix. If you'd like to give Chloe a furever home, you can visit her at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter!!
As the sun rises over the Arlington Police Department parking lot, we hope you have a great day! (and maybe that it warms up just a little bit)
UPDATE: Mr. Starks, our Silver Alert Missing Person, was found at a local hospital and is doing well. Thank you everyone for your concern and for sharing the original post!

Homicide Investigation We responded to an injured person at 900 Benge Dr.-4:36 p.m. We located a 16-year old male teen with an apparent gunshot wound who was later pronounced deceased at hospital. Active investigation. Anyone w/info pls call 9-1-1. Working with @ArlingtonISD

Ever wonder why we call our public safety center "Ott Cribbs" In this #ThrowbackThursday we explain why. Arthur B. "Ott" Cribbs started his career with the APD in 1925, was promoted to Chief in 1934 and served in that position for 37 years! https://www.arlingtontx.gov/residents/about_arlington/history_of_arlington/what_s_in_the_name_/ott_cribbs_public_safety_center

Here is the newest edition of our top ten most wanted fugitives. If you know their location, PLEASE call Crime Stoppers at 817-469-8477. Crime Stoppers of Tarrant County will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest. #TopTen #MostWanted @469

In honor of #BlackHistoryMonth, we would like to take the time to recognize those who helped forge the path for many of our officers today. This is Teresa Ivy, APD's first African American female police officer. Your service to this community and department won't be forgotten!
Inside APD highlights school partnerships with @ArlingtonISD @utarlington on our Hometown Recruiting. https://youtu.be/wtG8hTfOzP4
Not a bad sight to end the work day! #ArlingtonTX
She has been found safe near IH 30 and Six Flags. Thank you for your help!

We need your help in locating 66-year old Toni Walker, 5’3 140lbs & wears hair in a ponytail. She was last seen wearing a gray/blue jacket, black pants, & black sneakers. She has stars tattooed on her neck. Last seen on foot around ATT Stadium at 1030 am & suffers from dementia.
UPDATE: Wow!! You guys don’t waste any time! Our friends at Arlington Animal Services have informed us that Xena has been adopted!! Happy Friday indeed!! #ArlingtonTX

Who's ready for another adorable edition of #FureverFriday?! This week, we have Investigator Jennifer Archer posing with Xena, a 2-year-old Doberman Pinscher mix. If you're interested in giving Xena a "furever" home, you can meet her at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter!!

Tonight’s crash scene in the 4300 block of Matlock resulted in two fatalities and three injured. The crash remains under investigation and the roadway will remain closed for a couple of hours while detectives finish up. Northbound Matlock traffic is being diverted to Center St.
Northbound Matlock at Stevens closed due to a major crash. Traffic is being diverted eastbound on Stevens to Center. Delays in area.

On this #WhosThatWednesday we wanted to draw your attention to our Cold Case page on our website. Call Crime Stoppers of Tarrant County at 817-469-8477 to leave a tip and remain anonymous. Crime Stoppers pays for tips. @469tips https://www.arlingtontx.gov/city_hall/departments/police/community/crime_prevention/cash_for_crooks/cold_cases

Let’s talk about blocking intersections, y’all. It’s not cool. And it’s illegal to prevent cross-traffic from getting through. Please make sure you can get all the way through an intersection before you enter one. If not, wait at the light until you can. #TrafficTipTuesday

UPDATE: Well here's a nice little ray of sunshine to break through all the fog this morning!! Over the weekend, our #FureverFriday pup Brooks was adopted!! Here he is with his new family!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

Congrats to our Explorers who placed 1st OVERALL, 3rd in Accident Investigation, 2nd in Misdemeanor Traffic Stops, 2nd in Suspicious Devices, and 2nd in Investigations at a competition today. Clay Gleason also placed third in Bicycle Challenge. https://www.arlingtontx.gov/city_hall/departments/police/community/community_programs/youth_initiatives

Arrest made in homicide. On Friday, we were notified of an arrest made in the murder of Cedric Dawkins which occurred on January 1, 2020. Antonio Garcia, 27-years of age, was arrested in Los Angeles, California by the @USMarshalsHQ and @LASDHQ Working on extradition.

Working a major crash with a car that lost control and drove into a local restaurant in the 6000 block of S. Cooper this morning. The driver is unharmed and no one was inside the business. Investigators are looking into it as a possible medical issue and no charges are expected.
Looks good.

Time for another edition of #FureverFriday!! This week, Det. Thomas Stellato is teaming up with Brooks, a 4-year-old German Shepherd mix. If you'd like to give Brooks a "furever" home, you can meet him at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter, located at 1000 SE Green Oaks Blvd.

Fatality Crash this evening at 6:02 pm on S. Bowen near Park Row Drive involving a motorcycle and SUV. Operator of motorcycle was ejected and pronounced deceased at scene. Crash remains under investigation.

Thought you might enjoy some photos of our new satellite Harold K. Elliott Museum at our Main Station Patrol Briefing room. Yes, we used to wear tan uniforms! #ArlingtonTX #ThrowbackThursday – at Ott Cribbs Public Safety Center

It’s time for another edition of “Who’s That? Wednesday” — and this week, we need your help to ID this lottery looter. He’s stolen lottery tickets from multiple convenience stores in #ArlingtonTX. If you recognize him, please call Det. Stellato at (817) 459-5728.
UPDATE: the wreck has been cleared and Arkansas Ln has reopened.

Working a crash involving two cars and an @ArlingtonISD school bus at 4400 W. Arkansas and 2200 Woodside. Westbound Arkansas is closed at Woodside and eastbound Arkansas is closed at Little Rd. One adult and one teen transported as a precaution. No serious injuries reported.
UPDATE: Need a boost on this wet, gloomy Wednesday? This oughta help! Hazel, our most recent #FureverFriday pup, has been adopted!! Here she is with her new family!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

When two APD sergeants noticed that several kids at Lynn Hale Elementary were coming to school with old, worn down shoes, they mobilized the community — which delivered 200+ pairs of new shoes for the whole school! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

Its our #TopTen #MostWanted. Crime Stoppers will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to the arrest of these fugitives. If you have any information on their location, PLEASE contact Safe City Commission Crime Stoppers at 817-469-8477. You can remain anonymous. @469tips

With rain in the forecast, we wanted to “sprinkle” a few reminders on your feed about driving in wet conditions: -Make sure your wipers & tires are -If you hydroplane, steer in the direction you want to go -Slow down, leave room, don’t use cruise control #TrafficTipTuesday

The @USMarshalsHQ in Shreveport arrested 31-year old Leah Franklin for Murder resulting from the death of Antonio Merle on January 11, 2020. Medical Examiner ruled the case a homicide. The suspect remains in the Shreveport Jail pending extradition back to Tarrant County.
Our East Patrol District was present for the Lunar Festival at Ben Thanh Plaza in East Arlington today. It was a wonderful celebration!

Let's start the weekend off strong with another edition of #FureverFriday!! This week, Officer Stacie Brown had the pleasure of posing w/ Hazel, a 2-year-old terrier / pit mix. If you'd like to give Hazel a "furever" home, you can visit her at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter.

So they got with the Arlington Police Foundation — and together, they were able to get 200 pairs of brand new shoes for every student at the school. This afternoon, we got to surprise the kids with their new shoes — and other shwag that was donated! #ArlingtonTX

There’s no greater gift we can give the students of this community than our love and support. Today, the kids at Lynn Hale Elementary experienced that firsthand. Our officers who work at the school noticed that a lot of the students were coming to school with worn down shoes...

UPDATE: So it turns out Officer Herlihy was so smitten with this kitten she rescued, she went back to the Arlington Animal Shelter this week and officially adopted him!! Here she is with her new pal Samson #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

Fun fact alert!! Did you know that Arlington PD officers have been riding motorcycles for more than a century?! The department bought its first motorcycle back in 1912. Here’s an old photo we uncovered of APD’s motorcycle unit back in 1922. #TBT #ArlingtonTX

These two recently went to a car wash in the 2200 block of Pioneer Pkwy - but they weren't interested in cleaning out their pickup. Instead, they tried to clean out a coin machine at the business. If you recognize them, please call Det. Trinh at (817) 459-5805. #ArlingtonTX

We are looking for 3 subjects who were taking items from a store located in the 900 Blk. E. Randol Mill Rd. earlier this month. They loaded a cart with stolen items and displayed a weapon. If you recognize these suspects, call @469tips (817) 469-8477 #WhosThatWednesday

In case you hadn't noticed, #ArlingtonTX has a few road construction projects in progress. Ergo, we'd like to remind drivers to SLOW DOWN in work zones and obey the posted speed limits. Remember, traffic fines double when workers are present. #TrafficTipTuesday

Thanks to the U.S. National Football Team @USNFT for teaming up with us today to clean up a little bit of Arlington in some local neighborhoods! Your service to our community is much appreciated! #ArlingtonKindness #GoodWorks #NFLHuddleFor100 #USAFootballHuddleFor100

10 years ago, on Jan. 13, 2010, we were shocked by the sudden loss of Ofc. Craig Story. Craig‘s attention to duty was deep and his smile was contagious. We will never forget Craig’s legacy and sacrifice. Today we remembered him with an End of Watch Ceremony. #NeverForgotten

It’s about dang time!! Without @JimmyJohnson, there is no “America’s Team” — or “How bout them Cowboys?!” for that matter. Congrats Coach!! Well deserved!! #JimmyJohnson #DallasCowboys #PFHOF20 #ArlingtonTX
Beautiful colors in the sunset this evening to cap the cold weekend off.

UPDATE: Some happy news to pass along on this sunny Sunday!! Cowboy, who was our #FureverFriday pup a couple weeks ago, has finally been adopted!! Here he is with his new family!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity
Happy Sunday folks. The sun is out and temps are on the rise. Enjoy your day from Arlington’s Finest.

HOMICIDE INVESTIGATION On Saturday, January 11, 2020 at 2:44 a.m., officers responded to a reported stabbing in the 5700 block of Prescott Drive. A male subject was transported to a hospital where he was later pronounced deceased. Detectives investigating. 817-469-TIPS

Not your typical prisoner... Officer Herlihy was on patrol when she saw a scared, wet & cold cat in a storm drain. She took him under her wing, dried him & provided some of her lunch to him. She then got him to our shelter safe & sound. He will be available to adopt soon!
UPDATE: Great news everybody — and we’re not just talking about the snow! Ryker, our #FureverFriday pup, has been adopted!! Here he is with his new family!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity
Snow flurries falling across @CityOfArlington Don’t blink or you’ll miss them. Gotta love Texas weather with the extreme temp changes over past 24-hours. #dfwwx
Yes of course! Ran out of characters but our local radio do a tremendous job in keeping residents informed! @KRLD @WBAP247NEWS @570KLIF in addition to other stations

We wanted give a huge shout out to our local @NWSFortWorth & media stations for keeping us informed @Fox4Weather @NBCDFWWeather @wfaaweather @CBSDFW @cbs11doug @RickMitchellWX @GrantJNBC5 @JesseWFAA @BrianJamesNBC5 @KyleWeather @WxManDanHenry & many others Thank you!!! #dfwwx
Please continue to monitor local weather alerts for @CityOfArlington @ArlingtonTxFire #dfwwx
Tornado Warning issued for @CityOfArlington #dfwwx @ArlingtonTxFire
Please be weather aware and follow local media and the @NWSFortWorth The Parks Mall has sounded their weather alerts and requested shoppers shelter in place until storm has passed. #DFWWX
Tractor trailer with flatbed was exiting Six Flags Drive from westbound IH 30 and overturned. Minor injuries and no other vehicles involved. #DFWTraffic

Weather got you down? #FureverFriday is here to save the day! Today, we have Crime Prevention Officer Marisa Sandham posing with Ryker, a 1 1/2-year-old retriever mix. Want to give him a "furever" home? You can visit Ryker at the Arlington Animal Shelter! #ArlingtonTX

Aidan's dad is a civilian employee here at APD. Suffice it say that he and his wife have raised a very thoughtful and caring young man!! Way to go Aidan!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity #AustraliaBushFires

The Advocates for Special People in Arlington stopped by today and dropped off goodie bags for West Patrol Officers to thank them for their service. We are happy to serve all members of our community. Thank you for your appreciation! #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay
It’s officially official y’all. Welcome to North Texas Coach McCarthy! We hope you do A LOT of winning here in #ArlingtonTX! #DallasCowboys

Its Tuesday, Here is a traffic tip: As winter break comes to a close, remember AISD school starts up again this morning. Watch out for the kids in and around school zones and expect some extra traffic. Put those phones down in school zones too. #ArlingtonTX
Great sunset this evening. Have a great rest of the day folks!

2 suspects fled a recent traffic stop & attempted to hide in a creek. Lucky for them, our Aviation Unit spotted them from above & officers ended up saving their lives as hypothermia was setting in with the frigid water. They were so weak, officers had to carry them out to safety.

Our South Patrol Officers were busy this weekend getting some criminals off of our streets. They made 7 arrests and recovered weapons that were still warm from being fired. We continue to go after known offenders, guns and drugs to keep our community safe.
As the holiday period and weekend leaves us behind, we hope everyone has a great week!

FATALITY CRASH We responded to a single vehicle crash involving a car & light pole this morning in 5500 block of North Little School Road. Driver lost control & drove over the curb & struck the light pole. The driver, a man in his 30’s, was pronounced deceased at the scene.

MISSING PERSON FOUND DECEASED On Jan 3, 2020 at 11:44 p.m., we were notified by a city utility crew that workers had located a possible body in a wooded area in 7100 block of Webb Ferrell. The Medical Examiner has identified the body as Evan Lacey through fingerprint analysis.

Homicide Invest. We responded to 600 block of Greystoke Dr. in reference to multiple gunshots. Arriving officers found blood evidence. We later learned 2 persons arrived at AMH with gunshot wounds. One person deceased at hospital & other in surgery. http://817.469.TIPS

New year. New #FureverFriday y'all. Kicking things off in 2020 is Sgt. Jill Willis and Cowboy, a 1 1/2-year-old retriever / shepherd mix. If you'd like to give Cowboy a "furever" home, you can visit him at #ArlingtonTX Animal Services, located at 1000 SE Green Oaks Blvd.

Here is a fresh Most Wanted for 2020. If you have information on any of these wanted fugitives, please call Crime Stoppers of Tarrant County at (817) 469-TIPS (8477). Crime Stoppers pays up to $1,000 for info. leading to an arrest. @469tips #ArlingtonTX #TopTen #MostWanted

APD and @ArlingtonTxFire are working a manure spill at southbound 360 and westbound I-20 exit ramp. It is causing slick conditions and we hope to have it cleared up and ramp reopened by 4 pm. Take the Mayfield exit to get to I-20 and avoid it. #oops #ArlingtonTX

Feeling a little nostalgic with the new year. Can you believe just 20 years ago (At the end of the 20th Century) we were using the Motorola 9000-T Mobile Data Terminals in our patrol cars? WOW! We have come a long way!#ThrowbackThursday #TBT #HappyNewYear2020
What can we say? We just HAD to know where @KrisGutierrez got that sweet hat!! Thanks for hanging out in #ArlingtonTX tonight! We hope everyone has a safe and happy new year!! #LoneStarNYELive
Thank you @MansfieldPDTX K9 Oso and Handler Alejandro for your help over the years when you responded to assist our team. Congrats on a good retirement!

We want to wish everyone a safe and happy new year! If your plans tonight involve alcohol, PLEASE plan ahead -- and make arrangements to stay somewhere overnight or find a safe ride home. There is NO EXCUSE to drink and drive! #ArlingtonTX

Well #CowboysNation it may not have been exactly the season you wanted so far... but the @dallascowboys are only NFC team still in the hunt for the playoffs! We know they can do it! Let’s Go Cowboys! #WASvsDAL
Full rainbow to the east and gorgeous sunset to the west. #dfwwx
That’s a good group of officers! Best of luck #CottonBowl #PennState

UPDATE: We’ll have a brand new #FureverFriday pup to introduce you to next week, once everyone is back and fully recovered from the holidays. But we wanted to let y’all know that Milton, who we featured two weeks ago, has been adopted! Here she is with her new family!

We have understood the importance of Crime Prevention for a long time. Just look at the photo of this van and you can see it! Make sure to hide those purchases in your car as you head back to the stores this week. Thanks! #ThrowbackThursday #TBT

Tomorrow, Friday, Dec. 27 at 10 am a wreath ceremony will be held to recognize the 9th anniversary of our loss of Officer Jillian Michelle Smith. The ceremony will be held at Moore Memorial Gardens, 1219 N Davis St., Arlington, TX. The Public is welcome to attend. #NeverForgotten
Merry Christmas from all of us here at Arlington PD!
#ChristmasEve #SantaSighting

It’s Christmas Eve — and we are officially on Santa Watch!! Tune into our special report as we track his movements. Our friends at @GrandPrairiePD and @MansfieldPDTX are helping us keep an eye out for the big guy as well!! #ArlingtonTX
Tune in tonight around 7:30 pm for live reports in the field on Santa sightings. We have @MansfieldPDTX and @GrandPrairiePD assisting us in searching the skies! #SantaSighting

APD along with @MansfieldPDTX is seeking the public’s help in identifying this suspect who is possibly linked to 3 commercial burglaries of fine jewelry stores. Contact Tarrant County Crime Stoppers at 817-469-TIPS if you know this guy. https://www.facebook.com/186503035754/posts/10156441132165755/?d=n

Tomorrow is the big day.... Christmas Eve! We will be out on patrol with @ArlingtonChief Will Johnson along with @GrandPrairiePD @ChiefScesney and @MansfieldPDTX @MansfieldChief Tracy Aaron for possible sightings of Santa. Stay tuned! #SantaSighting

Have you seen 19-year old Evan Lacey? He is a missing person from Arlington who was last seen on Tuesday, December 17. His car was located yesterday under suspicious circumstances by @fortworthpd in the 4200 block of S. Hughes Avenue. Anyone with info call 9-1-1
We stopped a stolen vehicle from Cedar Hill and detained one suspect at this time near Cooper and High Point. Still searching area for other suspects.

UPDATE: Happy howl-idays indeed!! Arlington Animal Services just let us know the other pup we featured in this week’s #FureverFriday got adopted as well! Here he is with his new family! Best. early. Christmas. gift. EVER. #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

INSIDE APD: For more than 30 years, our #SantaCops program has worked to give deserving kids a brighter Christmas. Check out the video to learn the heartwarming story of how it all began -- and how it's grown to help 450 families! #ArlingtonTX

That was quick! We just got word that one of the pups has been adopted! Here's a photo of him with his new family! The other little guy (the one w/ the white paws) is still available. Fees for all adoptable pets at the #ArlingtonTX animal shelter are just $25 for the holidays!

It's #FureverFriday -- and today, you get a DOUBLE DOSE of cuteness!! This week, Det. Jennifer Rodriguez & Civilian Inv. Jeri Lyn Crocker are posing with a pair of 4-month-old Border Collie mixes. If you'd like to give them a "furever" home, visit Arlington Animal Services!

We received this video from a citizen recognizing 2 of our officers. “I waved over an officer in 25° weather to help me with my son’s car seat. She had a partner come help & between them both, they installed my son’s new car seat. Did I mention it was in the 20°s?!” #Kindness

We received information from a woman wanting to commend an officer that paid for her & her mother’s food order at a drive-thru restaurant. We researched the incident and determined it was Sgt. Klinkenberg in the South Patrol District. Thank you for your kindness & generosity!

We made this list. We hope y'all check it twice. Because we'd really like to find these naughty individuals -- and your help would be nice! If you have info regarding the whereabouts of this week's Top 10 Most Wanted, call Crime Stoppers at (817) 469-TIPS (8477). #ArlingtonTX

We got a visit this morning from @XFLRenegades , the new XFL team coming to #ArlingtonTX Globe Life Park in February 2020. Evidently they have some experience on how to make new friends at the Police Department. These are some nice gourmet donuts! #ThankYou @xfl2020

#ArlingtonTX is wonderful and diverse city. Our “Unidos” program helps us to better connect with our Hispanic community and build critical relationships w/ them. Unidos organizes meetings / events throughout the year — and tonight, they hosted a holiday party for families!!

It's #WhosThatWednesday, and we have one for the naughty list. On Dec. 7 a suspect was captured on video after he didn't want to pay for his Christmas gift. If you know him contact Det. Rhodes at (817) 459-6647. or call Crime Stoppers at (817) 469-TIPS (8477). @469tips
They sure earned this one!! We hope everyone had a fun afternoon in #ArlingtonTX — and that y’all get home safe!! #HowBoutThemCowboys?!
Happy Sunday from our Honor Guard! Hope everyone has a great day.

Need an extra kick of holiday spirit?! Arlington’s annual Holiday @LightsParade happens TONIGHT at 6:00!! A friendly reminder that we will be closing several streets in the Downtown area for the parade. A map of the parade route is below. #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity
Bet y’all didn’t know our officers had moves like these!! We see you @APDChiefAyala #SantaCops #ArlingtonTX

This is what it’s all about right here, folks! Because of this AMAZING community’s generosity, Christmas just got a little brighter for 450 deserving families. From the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU to everyone who made #SantaCops a success!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

Congrats to all of the new graduates of our Citizens Police Academy! This week, we celebrated High School Class #61, as well as Class #73 and #74. We’d also like to thank @APDChiefAyala, command staff, and the instructors for being there to help us recognize the grads!
Our new guy has yet to master Photoshop. So this was the best we could do on short notice... #TimInAGym

And to view or print out the 2019 trail map, click on the link below. #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity #LightsAtInterlochen https://assets.simpleviewinc.com/simpleview/image/upload/v1/clients/arlington/Interlochen_map_2019_9c54215f-3869-4a5d-8355-a0acc43e0aa6.pdf

The Lights at Interlochen open for the 2019 season TONIGHT!! Remember, traffic gets pretty heavy in the area, especially on weekends. Watch the video for a breakdown of everything you need to know before your visit! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity

It's #FureverFriday y'all! This week, Officer Leonard Moon had the pleasure of modeling with Milton, a 2-year-old terrier / pit bull mix. If you'd like to give this sweet girl a "furever" home, you can visit her at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter (1000 SE Green Oaks Blvd.)

'Tis the season of giving, y'all. For instance -- you call Crime Stoppers of Tarrant County and give them information that leads to the arrest of any of the folks in our "Top 10 Most Wanted", they'll give you up to $1,000. (817) 469-TIPS (8477) is the number. #ArlingtonTX

The victim in this case said they left the car running on their driveway to warm it up. As we head into the winter months, we'd like to remind citizens that you should NEVER walk away from your vehicle when it's running. PLEASE take your keys!! #ArlingtonTX

"WHO'S THAT?" WEDNESDAY: We need your help to identify these three individuals, who were spotted getting out of a 2002 Ford Focus that had been reported stolen. If you recognize them, please call Det. Wade Hardin at (817) 459-5671. #ArlingtonTX #WhosThatWednesday

Another heartbreaking loss. On behalf of the #ArlingtonTX community and police department, we extend our deepest condolences to the family, friends, and colleagues of @NassauBayTX Sgt. Kaila Sullivan. Our thoughts and prayers are with you.

Child Online Solicitation Operation Nets Several Arrests We led a special operation with @tarrantcountyso and @TxDPS which yielded 8 arrests for suspects who thought they were meeting up with 13-16 year old minor children to engage in criminal acts that exploit our kids.

How cool!! Elliott inspired us with his generous donation to our #SantaCops program — now, he’s #InspiringAmerica with this great story that aired this evening on NBC Nightly News. You’re a rockstar Tin Man #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity #TinManTough

4-Year-Old Elliott Wyche was born with half a heart. But it's big and full! He and his family collected toys to donate to our #SantaCops program. We were so touched, we decided to give him a little surprise -- to say thanks. Check it out! #ArlingtonTX
On behalf of our community and department, we offer our condolences to the family, friends and colleagues of @houstonpolice Sgt. Christopher Brewster. Please keep HPD in your thoughts and prayers.

UPDATE: Great news everybody!! We just learned our “Furever Friday” pup Argo was adopted this morning!! He’d been at the shelter since October, so we’re thrilled he now has a furever home!! Here he is with his new family!! #ArlingtonTX #AmericanDreamCity
ICYMI - November’s Edition if Inside APD featuring our South Retail District Unit filled with holiday safety tips. https://youtu.be/Dy8cUYq8YxY

ICYMI: #ATTStadium is hosting the @Big12Conference Championship in the morning. Kickoff is at 11 am. We hope all the @BUFootball Bears and @OU_Football Sooners fans have a great and safe time! #Big12Championship – at AT&T Stadium
Former Arlington PD Deputy Chief and now @utarlington @UTAPolice Police Chief Kim Lemaux appointed to chair @TCOLE Congrats!!

Thank you Mayor Williams, City Council, and @CityOfArlington for taking time to recognize the efforts of Officer Brock. We're big fans of her's too! #ArlingtonTX https://www.arlingtontx.gov/news/my_arlington_t_x/news_stories/brock_recognition

It's the end of the work week. It's BEAUTIFUL outside. And it's #FureverFriday y'all This week we have Officer Ruben Hilliard posing with Argo, an American Blue Heeler mix. If you'd like to give Argo a "furever" home, you can visit him at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter!!
Inside APD is out! This month we visit with the South Retail District Unit and talk about holiday safety. Enjoy!
You know what would be even cooler than these shoes? A win on #TNF!! Let’s go Big D!! Bring that W back home to #ArlingtonTX!! #DallasCowboys #DALvsCHI

In 1987 we had our 1st Citizens Police Academy class. Today we started a two day CPA, Class #74! They are taught by officers in different units of the P.D. and 9-1-1 operators. Interested in attending a future CPA? Call Ofc. Hayden at 817-459-6468 #ThrowbackThursday

***Traffic Advisory*** Westbound I-20 Fwy is currently closed as you head in to Fort Worth for emergency road repair. This is causing a backup to Matlock Rd. This is causing additional congestion in the area.

***Traffic Advisory*** I-20 in Arlington: ALL eastbound lanes of I-20 are closed at SH 360 due to a crash that occurred in Grand Prairie. Traffic is being diverted to SH 360. Expected to be closed for at least another hour and a 1/2. Seek Alt. Route #ArlingtonTX

Thank you @GrandPrairiePD @ChiefDye @ChiefCMartinez & Command Staff for recognizing our employees @ArlingtonChief, Lt. @cooktx, Sgt. Jill Willis, and APD Officers Troy Medina & PJ Brock for their help with a difficult time. #NeverForget Officer A.J. Castaneda EOW: June 7, 2019

Working a major crash investigation at the conclusion of a vehicle pursuit of a possible known offender operating a stolen car out of Granbury near Bowen Rd and Abram Street. Both north and south bound lanes of Bowen are temporarily closed for the crash investigation.
Hmmm. I called the desk and never gave that info so please check with your people. Lt. Cook
We are getting ready to provide details to media at the scene.
Not correct
This, sadly, was a suicide incident. Generally, the media doesn’t report on suicides so as not to glorify them.

Santa’s elves — err — Arlington’s finest are busy sorting all the toys that will be going to hundreds of deserving families here in our city for the holidays!! All of those bags are full of donations!! Wow!! Thanks to everyone who supported our #SantaCops program this year!!

Do you have some #CyberMonday bills to pay? Crime Stoppers will pay up to $1000 for information leading to the arrest of these fugitives. If you have information on their location, contact Crime Stoppers of Tarrant County at 817-469-8477 @469tips #Arlington #TopTen #MostWanted

UPDATE: Great news everybody!! Our friends at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter just informed us that Duffy — who we featured in this week’s #FureverFriday — was adopted this morning!!! Here he is with his new family!! #AmericanDreamCity
Fatality incident.
Working an incident westbound IH 20 at US 287. Only two left lanes get through for the next couple of hours. Delays back to Green Oaks.

Seeking the public’s help in identifying the driver involved in a fatal hit and run crash early this morning in 3500 block of E. Division. Read more: https://www.facebook.com/186503035754/posts/10156383803335755?sfns=mo

What better way to cap off the feasting and shopping than with another edition of #FureverFriday?! This week, Det. Paul Belauskas got to model with Duffy, a Great Pyrenees mix. If you'd like to give Duffy, a "furever" home, you can visit him at the #ArlingtonTX Animal Shelter!

Enjoy your shopping and dining today! As you head out, don’t leave valuables in plain view and secure your car doors. We have a lot of officers out in force today to ensure your day is fun and merry! Happy Friday folks!

Good morning everyone! We hope you have a Wonderful and Happy Thanksgiving! If you see our officers out and about, be sure to thank them too for working to keep all of us safe on this holiday!

It's "Who's That?" Wednesday! This week, we need your help to ID these 3 young men who broke into the Ben Thanh Market along E. Pioneer Pkwy and made off with several items they didn't pay for. (Rude, right?!) If you recognize them, please call (817) 469-TIPS. #ArlingtonTX

Our new Sky Watch towers are equipped with state-of-the-art cameras that will improve our ability to keep watch over some of our busiest areas -- like our stadiums -- to make sure criminals don't ruin the fun! Thanks @c_vandergriff and @CBSDFW for the story! #ArlingtonTX

#TrafficTipTuesday With Thanksgiving just 2 days away please be careful on the roads with heavier than normal traffic. Be sure to not text and drive, and remember on highways that the left lane is for passing only! Safe travels and Happy Thanksgiving!

South Side officers responded to a shooting report. They located a suspect and through their investigation were able to make an arrest and charge him with 7 different offenses. We were able to get this gun, and multiple drugs off of our streets.

#TrafficTipTuesday We had some wet roadways today so passing along these tips. 1. Be road ready (wipers & tires). 2. Headlights on. 3. Slow down and leave plenty of stopping distance between you & car in front of you. Read more: https://www.tdi.texas.gov/takefive/safety/driving-rain.html

A commercial truck has overturned northbound Watson at Abram Street. The cab is partially overhanging on the bridge over Abram Street so both east and westbound lanes of Abram are closed until wreckers can remove the cab. No serious injuries. Rig is hauling cooking grease/oil.
Rain is currently moving into southwest Arlington. We are expecting up to 4 inches of rainfall in the next two days. Plan extra time to get around and slow down on wet roads. #ArlingtonTX #txwx
Rush hour tonight should be okay, but in the morning please take some extra time and watch out for those areas that are prone to flooding. #TurnAroundDontDrown

You can help us prevent thieves like this from climbing into your car and ransacking it. This suspect broke into a car in the 6100 blk of Hott Springs and rummaged around until leaving with numerous items. Det. Evans at 817-459-6361. Keep those doors locked!

Today we salute our brave men and women for #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay . They risk their lives daily, to protect ours. We love you and appreciate the work done by each and every one of our officers.

We are looking to find this credit card thief. A victim’s vehicle was broken into in the 200 block of N. Mesquite St. and their credit cards were stolen. This suspect then used the victim’s cards to pile up over $1,000 in charges at multiple stores. Det. Jensen at 817-459-6482

It's the last few shopping days until Christmas. Don't become a victim of a burglary of your vehicle. Remember to: LOCK the car and never leave keys in it, TAKE any valuables with you, and HIDE anything else. Don't make your car look like Santa's sleigh!!

The work of preventing acts of violence rooted in hatred is a top priority for our profession. Equal protection under the law & preservation of civil rights for all persons is the cornerstone of what law enforcement stands for. Proud of @ArlingtonChief and his work on this topic

Ok. We have actually intercepted a few reckless drivers who have been reported on 911. You can also contact our Road Rage Hotline (817) 459-5389 to report incidents that are not in-progress and we will generate a letter to the registered owner. Have a good day sir.

In progress driving that is dangerous, please call 911 since our traffic officers are strategically placed throughout the city and on the highways. Videos that have identifying info can be forwarded to Jeff.pugh@arlingtontx.gov

If you have video of egregious driving, you should send it to us and we will absolutely pay an in-person visit to the person. We can’t mail citations to a registered owner... we have to be able to identify the actual driver.

Recap from this morning’s weather: 12 high water rescue calls, 1 swift water call (no rescue boat deployment was necessary), 8 Service Calls related to structures w/minor flooding (3 homes in the 2200 block of Park Springs received interior minor flooding). No injuries reported.
No. We put barricades up after we arrived and assisted them.

5800 block of Silo Road as officers began to arrive. This SUV was swept off the road by running water. Everyone was able to get to safety as First Responders directed people out of the water. Rain is still failing so drive careful and don’t drive around barricades.
Silo Road is closed at Harbor Town Dr in South Arlington due to flooded roadway. One family that was stranded in car was able to make it to safety.

Additional flooding w/stranded motorists at 3211 W. Division, 2800 Cannongate Dr, Woodland Park at Dancer, 2100 Park Springs, and 2300 Smokerise Drive. There is a significant amount of rain falling in @CityOfArlington so please be careful if you are driving. #TurnAroundDontDrown
They are rapidly changing as water overtake roadways and other streets recede. Check previous tweets.

These are the train tracks at Forest Edge which we believe has a 10’ clearance as a reference point. Please avoid rain soaked roads that have water covering the roadways. Working many stranded motorist calls this morning.

Additional videos from West Arlington with rain soaked roadways. This motorist turned around after attempting to maneuver the area with water flowing across the street. See other tweets for road closures.

Video from West Patrol showing how fast the waters can cover the roadways. We are responding with @ArlingtonTxFire on multiple road closures and stranded motorists. See previous tweet for locations. Don’t take a chance by driving over rain soaked roads that have standing water

Possible flash flooding reported with motorists stranded at multiple locations at Park Springs & Pioneer, Creekside & Ridgedale, Parks Springs at Randy Dr & 2300 English Oak. Do not drive on roads overrun by water. Your car can stall and become immobilized. #TurnAroundDontDrown

A self-inflicted wound would be classified as a suicide in progress and not a cutting. Cuttings can mean any edged weapon and are dispatched as emergency calls with officers responding lights and siren if in progress. There is no stabbing call type.

Congratulations to all of our volunteers who were recognized and received awards throughout the department for their commitment in serving alongside APD in 2017. All of our volunteers pour their heart into supporting us and this commitment does not go unnoticed.

In 2017, volunteers provided 29,623 hours to the PD with over 345 active volunteers serving in various capacities throughout the organization. We could not achieve what we do without their commitment and assistance. Thank you to all of our volunteers.

As Crime Victim Rights Week continues we want to address Family Violence. It can occur in many ways, ranging from abusive behavior physically and verbally. This can have consequences for victims If you feel afraid: Trust your instincts Have a Safety Plan Know Where to Get Help

The APD Victim Services Unit offers Grief Support Groups to individuals in the Arlington community that have lost a loved one to a traumatic death. Our groups are free of charge and meet one night a week.If you are interested in more information contact us at 817-459-5339.

Crime Victims' Rights Week starts today. The 2018 theme - Expand the Circle. The APD has counselors available seven days a week to help. If you need assistance, please contact the team between 6:00 a.m. and 2:00 a.m. at 817-459-5339.
Working major crash southbound US 287 at Turner Warnell. All southbound lanes closed for at least another hour. Delays in the area.

Today is National Dogfighting Awareness Day. The @ASPCA helped establish this day to raise awareness about the prevalence of this brutal form of animal cruelty. Help us spread the word to combat this heinous form of animal cruelty.

Time for some spring cleaning. Get rid of those old or unused medications safely. The drug take back is coming up in three weeks on April 28. There will be four collection sites around town that you can anonymously drop off those old prescriptions to be safely disposed.

The MAY Program, started in 2015 to help troubled youth by pairing them with officers to serve as mentors, expanded to include females in September of 2017. The relationships that are being built between officers and the youth will last a lifetime.

Talking is allowed in Texas unless you are in a school zone. Texting or reading/sending Facebook or emails is not allowed.
We expect officers to uphold all laws but what you initially reported was not a violation.

You tweeted us saying you saw an officer “talking” on his phone. Now you are alleging they were texting? Talking on the phone is allowed. drivers may not use a phone to "read, write, or send an electronic message while operating a motor vehicle unless the vehicle is stopped.”
You can talk on the phone.

You also raise a valid point that officers are unable to distinguish between real and fake guns and will respond to threats accordingly. Hope this helps you see why we are highlighting these community issues.

Because society needs to understand the proliferation of pellet/air soft/toy guns and the fact that criminals are using them more and more because they are easily accessible. We take a fair share of real guns off the streets also. We are educating the public on how they are used

A bad guy once again uses a fake gun during a robbery. The suspect approached the victim and demanded he turn over his wallet while brandishing this gun. Officers swarmed the area and arrested the suspect. This shows yet again the proliferation of these fake guns in our community
